metadata.description: Gustar-type verbs with special indirect object construction

present.spanish: Te gusta la música clásica más que el rock.
present.english: You (informal) like classical music more than rock.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te gustan los deportes acuáticos en verano.
present.english: You (vos) like water sports in summer.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Nos gusta viajar a lugares exóticos.
present.english: We like traveling to exotic places.
present.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Te gustó la comida del restaurante italiano.
preterite.english: You (informal) liked the food at the Italian restaurant.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Me gustó mucho la película que vimos anoche.
preterite.english: I really liked the movie we saw last night.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Le gustó el regalo que le dimos.
preterite.english: He liked the gift we gave him/her.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Te gustará la nueva casa cuando la veas.
future.english: You (informal) will like the new house when you (informal) see it.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Le gustará el nuevo trabajo en la empresa.
future.english: He will like the new job at the company.
future.subject: él

future.spanish: Le gustará el nuevo trabajo en la empresa.
future.english: She will like the new job at the company.
future.subject: ella

going-to.english: You're going to like it a lot.
going-to.subject: él

going-to.spanish: Me va a gustar la película.
going-to.english: I am going to like the movie.
going-to.subject: me

going-to.spanish: Te van a gustar mis amigos.
going-to.english: You are going to like my friends.
going-to.subject: te

present-perfect.spanish: Me ha gustado mucho el libro.
present-perfect.english: I have really liked the book.
present-perfect.subject: me

present.spanish: Me duele la cabeza después de trabajar.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te duelen los pies después de caminar.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Le duele el estómago por comer mucho.
present.english: His stomach hurts from eating too much.
present.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Me dolió mucho la espalda ayer.
preterite.english: My back hurt a lot yesterday.
preterite.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te dolerá la garganta si gritas mucho.
future.english: Your throat will hurt if you (informal) shout a lot.
future.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: Me va a doler la espalda.
going-to.english: My back is going to hurt.
going-to.subject: me

going-to.spanish: Te van a doler las piernas.
going-to.english: Your legs are going to hurt.
going-to.subject: te

present-perfect.spanish: Me ha dolido todo el día.
present-perfect.english: It has hurt me all day.
present-perfect.subject: me

present.spanish: Te encantan los libros de aventuras.
present.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Me encantó la película que vimos anoche.
preterite.english: I loved the movie we saw last night.
preterite.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te encantará el nuevo restaurante italiano.
future.english: You (informal) will love the new Italian restaurant.
future.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: Le va a encantar el regalo.
going-to.english: He is going to love the gift.
going-to.subject: él

going-to.english: I am going to love Paris.
going-to.subject: me

going-to.spanish: Te van a encantar mis padres.
going-to.english: You are going to love my parents.
going-to.subject: te

present.spanish: Me molesta el ruido de la construcción.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te molestan las interrupciones durante el trabajo.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Me molesta cuando hacen ruido tan temprano.
present.english: It bothers me when they make noise so early.
present.subject: ella

present.english: Do it bother you (formal) if I turn on the TV?
present.subject: usted

present.spanish: A ella le molesta que no la escuches.
present.english: It annoys her that you don't listen to her.
present.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Me molestó mucho su actitud ayer.
preterite.english: His/Her attitude really bothered me yesterday.
preterite.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te molestará el calor en el verano.
future.english: The heat will bother you (informal) in summer.
future.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: Me va a molestar el calor.
going-to.english: The heat is going to bother me.
going-to.subject: me

going-to.spanish: Te van a molestar los mosquitos.
going-to.english: The mosquitoes are going to bother you.
going-to.subject: te

present.english: Your friends matter a lot to you (informal).
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: No me importa lo que digan los demás.
present.english: I don't care what other people say.
present.subject: ella

present.english: Do you mind if I sit here?
present.subject: él

present.spanish: A nosotros nos importa mucho la familia.
present.english: Family matters a lot to us.
present.subject: usted

preterite.spanish: No me importó su opinión sobre mi decisión.
preterite.english: His/Her opinion about my decision didn't matter to me.
preterite.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te importará más la salud cuando seas mayor.
future.english: Health will matter more to you (informal) when you (informal)'re older.
future.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: Me va a importar el precio.
going-to.english: The price is going to matter to me.
going-to.subject: me

going-to.spanish: Te van a importar las consecuencias.
going-to.english: The consequences are going to matter to you.
going-to.subject: te

present-perfect.spanish: Me ha importado siempre la verdad.
present-perfect.english: The truth has always mattered to me.
present-perfect.subject: me

present-perfect.english: The details have mattered to him/her.
present-perfect.subject: le

present.spanish: Me faltan cinco euros para comprar el libro.
present.english: I'm missing five euros to buy the book.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te falta experiencia en este trabajo.
present.english: You (informal) lack experience in this job.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Me falta dinero para pagar la cuenta.
present.english: I'm missing money to pay the bill.
present.subject: usted

present.english: How much do you (formal) have left to finish?
present.subject: usted

present.spanish: A él le falta una semana para las vacaciones.
present.english: He has one week left until vacation.
present.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Me faltó tiempo para terminar el examen.
preterite.english: I lacked time to finish the exam.
preterite.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te faltarán ingredientes para la receta.
future.english: You (informal) will be missing ingredients for the recipe.
future.subject: tú

going-to.english: I am going to lack time.
going-to.subject: me

going-to.english: You are going to lack ingredients.
going-to.subject: te

present.english: It seems like a good idea to me.
present.subject: yo

present.english: These books seem interesting to you (informal).
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Me parece que va a llover hoy.
present.english: It seems to me that it's going to rain today.
present.subject: ella

present.english: What do you think of this restaurant?
present.subject: ella

present.spanish: A ellos les parece buena idea salir temprano.
present.english: It seems like a good idea to them to leave early.
present.subject: ella

present.english: It seems like a good idea to him/her.
present.subject: le

preterite.english: His/Her behavior seemed strange to me.
preterite.subject: yo

future.english: It will seem difficult to you (informal) at first.
future.subject: tú

going-to.english: It is going to seem strange to me.
going-to.subject: me

going-to.english: They are going to seem expensive to you.
going-to.subject: te

present-perfect.english: He has seemed very kind to me.
present-perfect.subject: me

present-perfect.english: They have seemed correct to him/her.
present-perfect.subject: le
